text:
Howdy! I was wondering if anyone in this channel has experience with custom property images in HubSpot emails. I have a client that is looking to add the contact's company logo into a email template. I know that HubSpot pulls the company logo from the domain of a contact, but I was wondering if there was a way to get a hold of this property and use it as a custom field in a way so that when the email was automated it would automatically send the contact's company logo on the email.

Thanks!

Hi! I don't think that field can be used as it's not a traditional contact property. They could create a custom contact property that is multi line text, and then add a link to the company logo in that property. When building the email (if using D&D), add the HTML module or create a custom module, add the code for an image and instead of the link, add the personalization token {{contact.propertyinternalvalue}} and there ya go, image personalization!
Thanks Dana! I will give that a shot
No problem! Let me know if you have trouble, I can always whip up a quick tutorial video on it. :slightly_smiling_face:

`<center>`
`<img src="{{contact.propertycompany_logo}}" alt="company logo" width="100" height="auto">`
`</center>`
So this it what I have, and I've been trying to get the image url to pull from the contact property, but it won't pull anything no matter what adjustment I make. I'm I using the property wrong here?
Are you previewing as a customer who has something entered into that property? If not, nothing will show :slightly_smiling_face:

Yeah I went and made the property and filled it in for a few customers. I have have a personalization token set up below my html to make sure that I'm getting a url through it. I just don't know how to get the {{contact.propertycompany_logo}} to pass my field and pull the image url from the field.
